title: Dorset and Hampshire Live: Friday 13 January - BBC News
summary: man admits raping teenager on isle of wight .
woman dies in 'chemical incident ' in poole .
two people rescued from their car after getting stuck in floodwater .
southern rail train drivers begin third strike this week .

documents.title: weather outlook : frost and icy patches
text: it 'll be mostly dry , clear and cold tonight , with widespread frost and icy patches .
it 'll be a cold and frosty start tomorrow , but it will be dry with sunny spells .
more cloud will develop in the west later , with a few showers , making it a little less cold .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: afc bournemouth right-back jordan lee joins torquay united on season-long loan
text: bournemouth right-back jordan lee has joined national league torquay united on loan until the end of the season .
the 20-year-old was part of the cherries side that lost at millwall in the fa cup last week , but is yet to make a league appearance .
`` i 've had a couple of people watch their games and their reports have been good , '' gulls boss kevin nicholson said .
`` they 've got a very good history of players coming through and they want them out to get that experience . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: jurassic coast fossil museum seeks new volunteers after £ 1m extension
text: lyme regis museum is looking for new volunteers ahead of its reopening following a £ 1m extension .
the building will reopen in june following the construction of a new wing commemorating the work of famous paleontologist mary anning .
her fossil discoveries in the 1800s contributed to important changes in scientific thinking about prehistoric life.undefined
the work includes a new gallery dedicated to the story of her work , a learning area for schools , exhibitions and events , and an extended shop .
the museum simply ca n't function without [ volunteers ] and we will need more when we reopen in june to carry out a wide range of exciting and interesting roles .
these include welcoming visitors to the museum , supporting our new shop , helping visitors to understand our collections and helping with events and activities .
volunteers need to be enthusiastic and well motivated .

documents.title: eastleigh extend loan of wolves defender hakeem odoffin
text: eastleigh have extended the loan of wolverhampton wanderers defender hakeem odoffin until the end of the season .
the 18-year-old initially joined the national league club on a month-long deal , and has started four games in all competitions for the spitfires .
odoffin is working under eastleigh manager martin allen , who gave him his barnet debut before the defender moved to molineux in january 2016 .
he is yet to make a senior appearance for the championship club .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cctv image released in connection with southsea lone women robberies
text: police have released a cctv image of a man they would like to speak to in connection with four robberies on lone women in southsea .
during three of the four robberies , which took place between sunday and thursday , the victims were assaulted - with one 63-year-old woman being kicked during an attack in boulton road .
hampshire constabulary has warned women in the area to be `` vigilant '' .

documents.title: bristol rovers sign eastleigh captain joe partington
text: league one club bristol rovers have signed eastleigh captain joe partington for an undisclosed fee .
the 26-year-old former wales under-21 international and bournemouth defender has been with national league eastleigh since an initial loan spell in 2015 .
a right-back who can also play at centre-half , he has started 63 league games for the spitfires .
eastleigh have said they have received a `` club record transfer fee '' for the deal after a release clause was met .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: breakingman admits raping teenager on isle of wight
text: a man has pleaded guilty to raping a teenager in a secluded car park in niton , isle of wight .
kevin finch , 36 , of no fixed abode , was remanded in custody to be sentenced at a later date .
the 18-year-old woman was up from sandown high street on 7 october and driven to a car park in old blackgang road where she was attacked .
prosecutors told portsmouth crown court they would not seek a trial for four other alleged offences including kidnap and inflicting grievous bodily harm , after finch offered pleas of not guilty .

documents.title: boy charged over alleged bournemouth lower gardens attack
text: a teenage boy has been charged following an attack in bournemouth which left a man with life-changing injuries to his eye , police have said .

the victim , aged in his 30s , was approached by a group of teenagers in the lower gardens ( close to exeter road in the early hours of 25 september , and one of the boys allegedly hit him with a metal belt .
a 16-year-old , from christchurch , has been charged with causing gbh with intent and is due to appear before bournemouth youth court later this month .

documents.title: rolf harris 'assaulted girl after autograph ' at portsmouth radio station
text: a woman who says she was indecently assaulted by tv presenter rolf harris has told his trial that he put his hand up her skirt after she asked for an autograph .
the woman said she was with her mother at a radio station in portsmouth , aged 12 , when the incident happened in 1977 .
she told the jury the alleged indecent assault was `` horrible '' and `` wrong '' .
mr harris , 86 , denies seven charges of indecent assault and one of sexual assault .
he is appearing at court via video link from stafford prison .

truck has been removed from m3 j9 slip road .
cheers guys

documents.title: up to five syrian refugee families 'could be resettled on isle of wight '
text: up to five syrian refugee families could be resettled on the isle of wight following unanimous support from the council 's executive committee last night .

isle of wight council said it had been investigating the possibility of resettling up to five families on the island , as part of the syrian vulnerable persons re-location scheme , since september 2016 .
part of this process has been the identification of suitable private rental properties and discussions with private landlords , it said .
funding to pay for the resettlement costs will be provided by the government .
i 'd like to sincerely thank all of those individuals who have come forward to offer help , assistance , gifts , goods and goodwill , to help these vulnerable families get started .
i 'd also like to clarify that the housing waiting list on the island remains unaffected by our decision to welcome these refugee families .

documents.title: retirement homes plan has 'many benefits ' for village
text: developer pegasuslife has defended its proposals to demolish the lyndhurst park hotel and build retirement flats on the edge of the new forest village .
pegasuslife plans to replace the disused hotel building with 74 `` age-restricted high quality assisted living '' apartments for which it said there was `` a very high need '' for .
twelve holiday lets are also part of the plan .
its proposal document states the hotel has `` many deficiencies '' and `` few historic features of particular architectural or historic merit '' following development in the 1960s and 70s .
more than 240 objections have been received during the planning consultation .
pegasuslife firmly believes its proposals for the hotel will enhance the site and provide many benefits for the village and people of lyndhurst .
the proposals have evolved as a result of our engagement with the local community as well as an assessment in line with planning policy .

documents.title: fire breaks out in over wallop farm buildings
text: firefighters are still dealing with a fire in farm buildings near andover .
a hampshire fire and rescue spokesman said they were called to salisbury lane , over wallop , shortly before 07:00 .
the operation has been scaled down but crews are continuing with `` external firefighting '' .
crews from dorset and wiltshire also helped tackle the blaze which is thought to have involved several vehicles on the site .
no-one is believed to have been injured .

documents.title: objections to lyndhurst park hotel demolition
text: campaigners against the demolition of the lyndhurst park hotel to build retirement flats , say there is `` overwhelming '' opposition to the plans in the new forest village .
developer pegasuslife wants to replace the disused building with 74 `` age-restricted high quality assisted living '' apartments .
more than 240 objections have been received during the planning consultation .
our young people are being priced out .
we need affordable housing for young families to bring some vibrancy into the village and help the businesses that are struggling .
our facilities like scouts , the brownies and the football team will all go if we do n't encourage young people to be able to live here .

documents.title: a day and night at southampton general hospital
text: a day and night at southampton general hospital

documents.title: southampton general hospital 'off black alert '
text: southampton general hospital has said it is no longer on black alert .
it 's the highest level of alert and warns the rest of the health network in the city that they need help to free up beds and relieve pressure on emergency departments .
radio 4 today programme reporter matthew price was at the hospital overnight :

the head of the hospital 's emergency department said thursday night was a lot quieter than the previous two when he described a real sense of a hospital struggling to cope with the number of people that it had in its walls .
despite coming off the black alert some patients who came into emergency overnight did have to wait more than the four-hour government target to get through the hospital system and into a bed .
author: Matthew Price
BBC correspondent

documents.title: crewman 'crushed to death by lift '
text: a crewman was crushed to death by a goods lift on board a cargo ship in the north sea , an inquest in winchester has heard .
gerome reyes , 26 , from the philippines , was alone in the galley of mv moonray , sailing from southampton .
the inquest heard that on 22 may , he activated the lift while the door was open and was dragged up as the lift ascended .
recording a verdict of accidental death , coroner grahame short said no door limit switch was fitted to the lift .
last year he referred the case to the crown prosecution service which confirmed it had no jurisdiction over deaths in international waters .

documents.title: woman who sparked poole chemical alert was bournemouth university student
text: a woman whose death sparked a chemical alert in poole has been confirmed as a bournemouth university student .
officers were called to the `` sudden death '' of the woman , aged in her 30s , at a property in gillet road , poole , where `` unknown chemical substances '' were found .
neighbours left their homes while the substances were removed on thursday .
the university described it as `` an isolated incident '' and said it was `` making support available for any student who has been affected '' .

documents.title: southsea robberies targeting lone women 'linked '
text: four robberies that have involved a man targeted lone women in southsea are being linked , police have said .
during three of the four robberies , which took place between sunday and thursday , the victims were assaulted - with one 63-year-old woman being kicked during an attack in boulton road (
the offender is described as skinny , about 5ft 5in to 5ft 7in , with possible stubble or a goatee-style beard and was wearing a dark-coloured jacket and hat or hood covering his ears .
hampsire constabulary is warning women in the area to be `` vigilant '' .
we are taking these incidents extremely seriously .
our concern is that somebody is intent on targeting lone women during daylight hours .
we have a strategy in place to identify the suspect ; we are carrying our house-to-house enquiries , checking cctv have put extra police patrols in place .

documents.title: woman dies and residents evacuated after chemicals found at poole property
text: a woman has died and residents have been evacuated from their homes after chemicals were found at a property in dorset .

officers were called to the `` sudden death '' of a woman , aged in her 30s , at a property in gillet road on thursday evening , where `` unknown chemical substances '' were found , dorset police said .
residents in surrounding properties were evacuated while the substances were removed , the force added .
the death is not being treated as sus

documents.title: poole town receive support from former striker charlie austin
text: southampton striker charlie austin is supporting one of his former non-league clubs in their bid to avoid demotion .
sixth-tier club poole town need to raise £ 70,000 to upgrade their home ground by the end of march .
austin , 27 , has told poole 's board they can have free use of his box at southampton 's st mary 's stadium to entertain potential investors .
he scored 48 goals in 42 games for the dorset club between 2008 and 2009 before moving to swindon town .
author: BBC Sport

text: weather outlook : ice warning and snow flurries

BBC Weather

documents.title: southern rail : train drivers stage third strike day of week
text: southern rail train drivers have begun a third strike day this week , bringing severe disruption to the network .
the aslef union is in dispute with southern 's parent firm govia thameslink ( gtr ) over guards ' roles on trains .
drivers walked out for 48 hours on tuesday and wednesday and more strike days are planned later this month .
southern has accused the union of abusing its power but aslef chief mick whelan said the firm had tried to force through changes rather than negotiate .

documents.title: two rescued from floodwater near portsmouth
text: two people have been rescued from their car after it got stuck in flood water north of portsmouth .
cosham fire crews went to help at about 18:00 yesterday .
another crew from brockenhurst had to help a woman who got stuck in her car under a bridge an hour earlier .
cosham are at a water rescue in purbrook , 2 casualties have been led 2 safety & handed over 2 scas @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
and the moto do n't try and drive through floodwater
errr u couldnt see the water ! ! ! !
not being funny , but if you ca n't see the road/water , slow down some ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
but glad your ok .
we were going slow and the road was a national .
by time we hit the water the current pulled the car in deeper
easy to get caught out there , seen a few in similar conditions there in the flash floods .
i always go by 30cm is too deep
which is the environment agencies advice .
glad your ok @ twitterid and well done to the emergency services .
thanks for rescuing them , shame they needed it .
how could they have missed that much water ?
@ twitterid

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to our local live service for dorset , hampshire and the isle of wight on this chilly friday .
we 'll be bringing you the latest headlines from across the three counties .
you can get in touch too , via email , on our hampshire and dorset facebook pages or on twitter @ bbc hampshire and @ bbcdorset .
